relevant_findings.general: alert, oriented, grabbing abdomen due to pain
relevant_findings.HEENT: pupils constricted equal bilaterally and reactive, mucous membranes moist, oropharynx clear
relevant_findings.lungs: clear to auscultation bilaterally, no wheezes, rales, or ronchi
relevant_findings.cardiovascular: regular rate and rhythm, normal S1 + S2, no murmurs, rubs, or gallops
relevant_findings.abdomen: obese, soft, non-distended, hypoactive bowel sounds, tender to palpation throughout, no rebound tenderness or guarding
relevant_findings.extremities: warm, well perfused, 2+ pulses, 2+ edema to mid shins bilaterally, skin changes consistent with chronic venous stasis

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: patient remains uncomfortable and unable to sit still without grabbing abdomen, signs of nausea and vomiting bile, persistent abdominal pain
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient's pain reported to be similar to home pain but slightly worse, nausea increased, and experienced vomiting which reflects a possible worsening condition.
